resolve.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty
resolve.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The crisis was resolved by negotiations.
Barnet was desperate for money to resolve his financial problems.
resolve.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to make a definite decision to do something
resolve.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: After the divorce she resolved never to marry again.
Mary resolved that she would stop smoking.
resolve.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to make a formal decision, especially by voting
resolve.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The Senate resolved to accept the president’s proposals.
resolve.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to separate something into its different parts
resolve.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: DNA samples were extracted and resolved.
resolve.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: Action is being taken to resolve the problem.
Negotiation is the only way to resolve the dispute.
Has the issue been resolved yet?
She and Rose had finally resolved their differences.
Some problems still hadn’t been satisfactorily resolved.
It is a row that may never be fully resolved.
We wanted to resolve the situation peacefully.
We will always do our best to resolve complaints amicably.
The matter was resolved quite quickly.
resolve.translation[1].definitions[0].de: strong determination to succeed in doing something
resolve.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Recent events strengthened her resolve to find out the truth.
resolve.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to find a satisfactory way of settling a disagreement, dispute etc
resolve.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: Most pensiondisputes will beresolved within a year.
resolve.translation[2].definitions[1].de: to make an official decision, especially by voting
resolve.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: The directors have resolved to ask the company to appoint a receiver.
